ARABIC: إِنَّ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ كَانَ أُمَّةً قَانِتًا لِّلَّهِ حَنِيفًا وَلَمْ يَكُ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Ibrahim was a community in himself, exemplary, obedient to Allah, a man of pure natural belief. He was not one of the idolaters.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Abraham was certainly a model of faith, obedient to God and upright, and not one of idolaters,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Indeed Abraham was a whole community by himself, obedient to Allah, exclusively devoted to Him. And he was never one of those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Abraham was, certainly, an obedient and upright person. He was not a pagan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed Ibrahim was a leader, obedient to Allah, and detached from all; and he was not a polytheist.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, Ibrahim was (himself) an Ummah, obedient to Allah, a Hanif (monotheist), and he was not one of the idolators.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely Ibrahim was an exemplar, obedient to Allah, upright, and he was not of the polytheists.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely, Abraham was a nation obedient unto God, a man of pure faith and no idolater,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! Abraham was a nation obedient to Allah, by nature upright, and he was not of the idolaters;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Abraham was a community in himself devoted to God and true in faith, He was not one of the polytheists;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily Ibrahim was a pattern, devout unto Allah, upright, and, not of the associaters.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed Abraham was a nation [all by himself], obedient to Allah, a Hanif, and he was not a polytheist.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Abraham was indeed a model, devoutly obedient to Allah, (and) true in Faith, and he joined not gods with Allah:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, Ibrahim (Abraham) was an Ummah (a leader having all the good righteous qualities), or a nation, obedient to Allah, Hanifa (i.e. to worship none but Allah), and he was not one of those who were Al-Mushrikun (polytheists, idolaters, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, and those who joined partners with Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Abraham was (equal to) a nation, obedient to Allah, of pure faith and was not among the idolaters,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Abraham was an exemplary leader, devoted to God, a monotheist, and was not of the polytheists.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader, devoutly obedient to Allah, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [16:120] Truly Abraham was a community, a leader (imām), a [good] example, comprising [in his character] all the good traits, obedient to God, a hanīf, inclining towards the upright religion, and he was not of the idolaters;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! Abraham was a nation) a leader who was emulated (obedient to Allah, by nature upright) sincerely surrendered to Allah, (and he was not of the idolaters) he did not follow the idolaters in their religion;
